Она купит маленьких бычков и телят после 30-35 дней откорма продаст их на скотном рынке. Сумму, которую просит Фариштамо является маленьким для бизнеса которую она начинает. Фариштамо надеется, что она достигнет своей цели и сможет начать свой бизнес. Она верит, что ей помогут, и она реализует свою мечту.
texts.en:
Farishtamo is a resident of the Farkhor district.  She is 54 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  Her oldest son is currently working in Russia.  Her daughter and youngest son still live with her.  Farishtamo is a homemaker and her husband is a farmer.   He owns four hectares (9.88 acres) of land and is involved in agriculture.  Farishtamo helps him with his farming business.

Following the example of her neighbors and fellow countrymen, Farishtamo has decided to launch her own business which will consist in buying and selling livestock.  Tajikistan's main sectors of activity  are crop farming and cattle breeding.  Farishtamo is taking a loan which she will use to buy young livestock.  She will buy young bulls and calves, will feed them for 30 to 35 days and then resell them at the cattle market.  The sum that she is requesting for this loan is quite small for the type of business she is planning to launch.

Farishtamo hopes to be able to reach her goals and to start her new business.  She has confidence that she will receive help, which will help her to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and get involved in animal husbandry.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en: Pastora operates her retail business in addition to farming to earn a living.  Pastora has been in her business for 12 years and she has been able to sustain their living. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and her previous loan that she used for her store was successfully repaid. Currently, she borrowed a new loan to buy organic fertilizer for the farm. In the future, Pastora hopes to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano, es un agricultor que cuanta con una familia formada por su esposa, cinco hijos y el, todos viven juntos, sus hijos estudian mientras él y su esposa trabajan en las labores agrícolas. Los conocimientos que tiene de la agricultura los aprendió de su padre y hoy es la forma que tiene para generar los ingresos necesarios para aportar en los gastos de su hogar.
Invertirá en la compra de abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, insecticidas, que son los recursos que necesita para preparar la tierra y sembrar la postrera de maíz. Espera tener un mejor trato para su cultivo, mejores ingresos, una cosecha mayor a la de años anteriores.
Sueña con crecer en su negocio, mejorar su economía, pues sus hijos están creciendo y necesitan buena alimentación, salud y educación superior de calidad.
texts.en:
Mariano is a farmer whose family is made of his wife, five children, and himself. All of them live together. His children go to school, while he and his wife work in agriculture. Mariano gained his knowledge of agriculture from his father, and today it is the way he earns the income he needs to cover his household expenses.

He will invest in the purchase of fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and insecticides, which are the resources he needs to prepare the earth and to plant his crop of corn. He hopes to have better treatments for his crops, better earnings, and a larger harvest than in previous years.

He dreams of growing his business and improving his financial situation, since his children are growing and need good food and health as well as high-quality education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.ru:
Степан – из Берегово. Он работает частным предпринимателем уже 29 лет, ремонтирует автомобили, у него много своих клиентов. 
Степан живет в своем доме, как и большинство жителей Берегово. Наступают холода, температура опускается ниже нуля. Поэтому Степан хотел бы модернизировать систему отопления в доме, чтобы обеспечить своей семье тепло зимой. Дело в том, что котел и трубопроводы отопительной системы устаревшие, и из-за дырявых труб пропадает вода из системы и воздух попадает в радиаторы, за счет чего они не греются. Для установки нового котла и труб необходима сумма в 20 000 гривен.
texts.en:
Stepan is from Beregovo.  For the past 29 years, he has been working as a private entrepreneur, providing car repair services to many clients.

Like the majority of Berogovo's residents, Stepan lives in his own house.  With the arrival of the cold season, temperatures sometimes drop below zero.  For this reason, Stepan would like to update the heating system inside his house, to make sure that his family stays warm this winter.  His house's boiler as well as his heating system's pipes are obsolete: water is leaking through the pipes and air gets into the radiators, so they are no longer heating.  

Stepan needs 20,000 Hryvnia to install a new boiler and replace the pipes of his heating system.

loans.use: to upgrade the heating system in his house.

loans.name: Adolfa

texts.en: Adolfa is a 55-year-old married woman from Loboc, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for five years now. She is determined to make her hogs healthy in order to have a better return of her investment. Adolfa is requesting a loan to buy piglets, supplements and feed. In the future, Adolfa dreams of expanding her business and building a bigger piggery for increased income. Her profit allows her to save and pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to buy piglets, supplements, and feed.

loans.name: Niko

texts.en:
Niko is 33-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two daughters in the small village of Lagodekhi district. Niko works hard on the family-owned land, growing maize. He always has high quality product, which is sold locally at a good price. In addition, he has three pigs. 

Niko decided to expand the husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $1,900 for purchasing a cow and calves. He will start producing cheese to sell, as well as for family use. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and calves.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина живет и работае в городе Дрогобыч. Она работает в финансовой компании. У Ирины есть муж и двое  маленьких дочек. 
Ирина планирует делать ремонт дома. Для этого ей необходима сумма в 10 000 гривен. Ирина так мечтает обустроить свой дом и сделать его более уютным для своих дочерей, но собственных средств на все не хватает. Поэтому она и рассчитывает на содействие КИВА.
texts.en:
Irina lives and works in the city of Drogobych.  She works for a financial company.  She is married and the mother of two young daughters.  

Irina is planning to repair her house, and she needs 10,000 Hryvnia to do so.  Her dream is to renovate her house and make it more comfortable for her daughters, but she doesn't have enough money.  She is therefore counting on KIVA's assistance.

loans.use: to completely remodel her house.

loans.name: Yoweri

texts.en:
Yoweri is a farmer who grows tea for sale so that he can support his family by providing for the family members using the money he gets as profit from the sale of tea. He works four days on the tea farm and spends three hours on the farm per day. He started tea farming in 2008 and has sustained the business to date despite the challenges involved. 

The tea farm is located in a village in Butare, and he is determined to expand it given the opportunity of additional capital in the form of a loan. Yoweri has a motorcycle that he uses to carry people at a relatively small fee to get additional income, and this really helps him, especially when it's not a season for harvesting tea. 

He would like to use the loan money of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy fertilizers to boost the fertility of the soil so that he can harvest in big quantities and get better profits. He is very hopeful that his business will grow from one level to a higher level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his tea farm.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Sarah, who carries out farming in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. She has carried out farming for 30 years, and her source of income comes from the sale of milk and crops like maize, potatoes and bananas. She faces the challenge of there being no market for her products, but when she is able to get a ready market, she enjoys the profit she earns out of it.

Sarah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans. She also learned that MFIs [micro-finance institutions] do encourage small-scale farmers to develop a lifestyle of saving.

This loan will help her start up an agrovet business that will also provide her crops and livestock with pest and disease controllers, thus causing them to produce more. This will improve her income base and hence, improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To start up an agrovet business that will also provide her crops and livestock with pest and disease controllers.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor is married with four children helped her husband in running their transportation service based business in the community of Oroquieta City. Her husband is the one operating the motorcycle carrying passengers and baggage for five years to earn a living. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit for motorcycle maintenance costs. Her future plan for the business is to acquire another unit of motorcycle for business expansion. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family .

loans.use: for motorcycle maintenance costs.

loans.name: Zebra Group

texts.en:
Sharifa, who is in her late 30's, is married with four children. Three of  them are still at school and one has finished studying.  She has been running a beauty salon for five years now.  She works from 8 AM to 9 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sharifa's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan to buy more salon equipment so that her salon will set a high standard.  She dreams of having an international salon.

Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group, Zebra, which has eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment and so that her salon will set a high standard

loans.name: Maryana

texts.ru:
Марьяна живет и работает в Королево. Ей 35 лет, она в разводе, у нее двое детей. Она работает с среднеобразовательной школе техничкой. Работает уже 7 лет. Более того, дома у нее большое хозяйство: куры, свиньи и т.д.), что приносит ей дополнительный доход. 
Марьяне нужна сумма в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать на кухне косметический ремонт. Дом у нее старенький, давно не делался ремонт. Поэтому с кухни Марьяна и хотела бы начать. Сама не могла потянуть ремонт только на свои средства, так зарабатывает немного, еще и много расходов с детьми.
texts.en:
Maryana lives and works in Korolyovo, Ukraine.  She is 35 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children.  For the past seven years she has been working as a maintenance person at a secondary school.  Besides her job, she also keeps many farm animals at home (chickens, pigs etc.), from which she derives an additional income.

Maryana needs 5,000 Hryvnia to perform some light repairs in her kitchen.  Her house is quite old and hasn't been repaired for a while, and Maryana has decided to start with the kitchen.  She cannot afford to pay for these repairs on her own because she makes little money and has a lot of children-related expenses.

loans.use: to perform some repairs in her kitchen.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional sack of rice to sell.

Maryjane has been in this business for three years. Maryjane earns additional income from a general store.

Maryjane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sack of rice to sell

loans.name: Rochie

texts.en:
Rochie is 35 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rochie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

Rochie has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy spare parts, tires, paints, etc. for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Analyn has been in this business for 8 years. Analyn earns more income from buy-and-sell dry goods.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, tires, paints, etc. for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a single man; he describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a restaurant where he cooks food to sell. He describes his family challenge to be water shortage. 

He will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a 1,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a 1,000 litre water tank

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking mother with two children. She runs a hog-raising business, particularly hogs for breeding. Beatriz learned this kind of business from her parents. Since her parents died already, Beatriz kept this business up to this time. She has been running this business for 30 years. After disposal of her hogs, she then immediately bought the daily needs of her family.

Beatriz wants to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feed for maintenance of her hogs. She is hoping for approval of her requested loan, so she can operate the business well and be able to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed for maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vilma hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of having a partner in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh is a fifty-year-old married woman with two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past 26 years she and her husband have run a food stall to cover all of the family’s living expenses and their children's education fees.

Minh has borrowed and successfully repaid money through CEP before. She would now like to take a further loan to buy food and beverages for her food stall. 

Minh hopes that this loan of 20,000,000 VND will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages for her food stall

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa is a rural villager from Battambang Province's Banon District where rice cropping is the common way to earn a living. Channa is 20 years old and single. To make a living, he has been farming rice for three years. He can earn about US$4 per day but he can save about US$1 each day after daily expenses.
This is Channa’s first-cycle loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now he is applying for an education loan to pay his university’s tuition fee. Channa very much hopes that this loan will enable him to obtain a higher education background so that he can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay his university’s tuition fee

loans.name: Chamroen

texts.en:
Chamroen is 41 years old.  She is a married mother who lives in the Banon District of Battambang Province.  She plants rice and raises pigs and cows.  With 10 years of experience in these businesses, she is able to earn up to 8 USD per day and to keep 1 USD each day as savings. 

Chamroen is just with VisionFund for this loan cycle.  Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her son’s university tuition.  She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation and also that it will help to relieve her family's financial burden so that she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is aged 21 years old and married. She is the mother of one daughter. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice twenty-two years and supplement their family’s income by planting rubber trees and to better support her big family, they sometimes work for others for a fee. 

Mom’s group consists of four female members who live in the same village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is the second cycled client while the other two members are just the first cycled clients with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Mom, who is the leader, will user her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phone credit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the seeds of string beans, gourds, water spinach, and mustard greens

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is married with six children. Melecia is fifty years old and lives in Guipos, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Melecia is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for twenty years. She requested a of five thousand pesos to buy additional bags of farm inputs.                                                           

Melecia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Melecia hopes to harvest more corn crops.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 32 years old and married. She has two primary school-aged children. She lives in Bonifacio Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a carpenter. Jennifer is engaged in a livestock business, raising animals such as chickens and piglets. She could earn a monthly income of 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. Jennifer requested a new loan to additonally purchase materials for use in renovating their kitchen. She became a new Member of Credit Union Microfinance Innovation of PMPC and hopes to maintain a member in good standing with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase materials for use in renovating their kitchen.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a manicure (services) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials/tools like nipper, nail cutter, nail polish, etc., for her manicure (services) business.

Mila has been in this business for 26 years. Mila earns other income from buying and selling spices.

Mila has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, like nipper, nail cutter, nail polish, etc., for her services

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai, 51, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including three sons, and one daughter. She is widowed and supports her family through her business producing slippers. Mai is sometimes unable to provide the volume of slippers required by her customers. Consequently, she would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of materials such as rubber to make slippers and increase her production to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy materials such as rubber to produce and sell slippers.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is 50 years old and is married. He and his wife have been running a business of selling leather shoes for 10 years. Sang started this business to cover his expenses and raise two sons. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Sang is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying many kind of shoes for selling so that he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. 

He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy many kind of shoes for selling.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buy and sell rice grains. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail cutter, nipper, pusher and other tools for her manicure business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail cutter, nipper, pusher and other tools.

loans.name: Yerr's Group

texts.en:
Aged 55 years old, Yerr is a widowed mother of five children living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Bean planting is the main source of family’s income and supplementing the income by selling grocery items and snacks. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is able to earn about 16,000KHR per day, but she can save about 4,000KHR each after daily expenses. 

Yerr has been a member of VisionFund for eight cycles ago, and she completely repaid the past loans, which has enabled her to better support her family and have some money. Now leading her group of three to apply for a loan, Yerr, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her bean healthfully and sells it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Korm

texts.en:
Korm is 33 years old and married. He has three children to support; one is too young for schooling and two are in school. To earn a living, he does rice farming and works for others for a fee. 

Including this loan, he is a sixth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of his past loans enabled him to improve his lifestyle in a gradual pace. 

For this cycle, he is seeking 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer, pay for labor cost, as well as buy insecticide for his crop. He hopes that he can gain triple yield better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for labor cost, as well as buy insecticide for his crop.

loans.name: Trieu

texts.en:
Trieu is 51 years old, and is married. He and his wife have been running business of selling fertilizers for 10 years. He started this business to cover his expenses and raise his two sons. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Trieu is requesting a loan to expand his business by offering a larger quantity and variety of fertilizers that he will use to increase the turnover of his business. 

He hopes that through the loan, he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest to his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to sell at his business.

loans.name: Kashif Ali

texts.en:
The person who is shown in the picture is named Kashif Ali. He is 25 years old and lives in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been successfully running a small general store for many years. 

His shop is situated in a well-populated area and many customers are available here to buy miscellaneous general-store items. He wants to cope with the demand successfully, but for this purpose some stock is required. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in the daily routine. In this way, he will be successful in winning the trust of his customers and will increase his income as well. 

He wants to offer additional items such as bread, jam, a few stationery items, soft drinks, and ice cream. But he does not have enough money to buy the described items.Therefore, Kashif Ali requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy additional items such as bread, jam, stationery items, soft drinks, ice creams, etc.

He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will be successful in fulfilling each request for any item and can abstain from the disappointment of his customers.  Kashif Ali is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, and he assures us that he will pay all installments due in his first loan with regularity

loans.use: A loan helps Kashif Ali to buy rice, bread, jam, stationery items, soft drinks, ice cream, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is from  Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Ocidental, Mindanao: Philippines. She  is  55 years old and is married with six kids. 

In 2008, Flordeliza applied her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of  member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Presently, Flordeliza is asking for financial assistance in the amount of Php 14,900 to pay for additional kilograms of fruit for her fruit vending business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for additional kilograms of fruit for her fruit vending business

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en: Nhan, 39, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Nhan and her husband earn money through their business of making clothing. Nhan would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of cloth and sewing materials to make clothes to meet her customers' needs. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of cloth and sewing materials to make and sell clothes

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh is a 52-year-old married man with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife support their family by selling beef. Minh would like to get a loan to buy better quality beef to sell in his shop to better meet his customers' needs. He hopes that the loan will help him to increase his income and save money.

loans.use: to buy better quality beef to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Heaven Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn is the featured borrower of Heaven's group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines seeking work to provide their families with a better living. 

Jocelyn is 39 years old and married, the mother of five children.  She works as a housekeeper to provide her children with the best education and living.

Jocelyn's loan will be sent to her family back in Philippine husband and children, to cover their school and financial needs. She is working hard so that one day she'll buy her own beautiful house for her family in the Philippines.

She is the lady with red top at the right of the picture. As for the other group members, Florita is the lady with the grey top, and Corina is the first from the left.

loans.use: to send money back to her children in the Philippines to cover their school and financial needs

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 55-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. She has been working as a housekeeper for many years cleaning houses upon client’s request. In parallel, and as a wish to augment her income, she works as a housekeeper at a local bank. Her husband works as a car mechanic. 

Even though, the family’s income is barely adequate, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l with the intention of enhancing her way of work by purchasing new cleaning tools and a machine to clean carpets. Marie is an optimistic person who always seeks the best for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase new cleaning tools and a machine to clean carpets

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 28-year-old married woman. She lives in a poor area in Taiz, Yemen. 

She has been working in the public sector with a monthly salary that she uses to support her family. She works hard daily, and she loves her career.  

She is requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop. This will enhance her skills in using the computer and speed the process of doing reports for her work, which will ensure better conditions for her work. 

This will ensure a better future and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop.

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed, about 34 years old, is the group leader of a three-member group from Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a grocery shop. Her family is comprised of six members, including her husband and two sons, ages about 6 and 8 years. 

The member standing in middle with raising hand is Naheed. Her husband helps a lot in her business to earn their livelihood. She is a very active lady who wants her husband to get some extra income from the grocery shop.

Naheed, along with two other members of her town, formed a group and this is their fifth loan from BRAC Pakistan for the development of their existing business. At present, her family monthly income is very low, and not sufficient to manage her family and to keep pace with the present society.

To improve her living conditions and earn some extra income, she wants to take a loan. With the loan, she will add some grocery items like rice, pulses (legumes), flour, sugar, wheat, sugar, tea, etc. to the existing business of her husband. 

Naheed thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: A portion of Naheed Group's loan helps a member to purchase rice, pulses, flour, sugar, wheat, sugar, tea, etc for the grocery shop of her husband.

loans.name: Anwer

texts.en:
Anwer is a 51-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has a daughter and four sons; her husband does work in a firm at low wages.

She owns a small business of selling ladies’ ready-made garments at home. She purchases ready-made garments from the market at a low price and sells them at a high price. The ladies of the town like her clothing collection and selection a lot and demand more variety. Her husband affords all the expenses from his earnings, and she contributes her earnings only for savings. 

She requested a loan so that she could buy more variety of garments to fulfill the demand.

Anwer wishes for the bright future of her children, and her dream is to provide a better education to them.  

She is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy winter weather clothing to sell.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia belongs to an ultra poor family and lives with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories, which are used for houses, doors, and windows. With the help of a welding plant, he has been making iron doors and windows in addition to fixing broken accessories.

Recently, his welding plant was broken due to overheating, and he wants to buy new welding plant. He does not have the money due to lot of household expenses. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from BRAC, an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy a welding plant for manufacturing. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a portion of Razia's Group's loan helps a member to buy a welding plant for manufacturing.

loans.name: M. Afzal

texts.en:
M. Afzal is a milkman by profession and sells milk in his community. He has been selling milk for many years, and now he is very experienced in his profession. He is very expert in getting milk from a buffalo; he gets it from all his buffaloes in no time. He has many buffaloes, which is the reason he has to work very hard to arrange fodder for the herd. 

His is taking a loan for the establishment of business and to increase his herd. He still wants to establish his business further and wants to buy more heifers so that he can increase his monthly income and savings as well. He decided to buy heifers because a heifer is cheaper than a buffalo and they grow up in a short time. He will feed them in a better way and he will pay his full devotions for heifers, he hopes that they will grow up soon and he can get milk from them. 

Therefore, M. Afzal requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He hopes that he will be able to buy heifers and that he will succeed in increasing his monthly income and his herd as well. He thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy heifers to increase his herd.

loans.name: M. Saqib

texts.en:
M. Saqib is a 26-years old man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He works hard to provide better living standards to his family by selling gift hampers and decoration pieces. He purchases all gifts and decoration pieces from the market and then sells it to the general public. Most of the sales he made at festivals, occasions and on ceremonies. He has become famous by providing good quality gifts and has retained many customers. He earns enough money to support a decent life. During this tenure he experienced that most of his female customers demand for the beauty products a lot. This is the reason he decided to offer cosmetics products also with the gift hampers. 

Therefore, he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that he could offer beauty products also with gift hampers. This is his first loan and he assured us to pay all the installments on due time. He is very experienced in his business and confident that his business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.
He is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products to sell

loans.name: M. Saeed

texts.en:
M. Saeed is aged of 34, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is very hardworking and gentle person. He is responsible for his five children and old parents as well. 

He is a milkman by profession and supplies milk in his community. He has been selling milk for many years and now he is very expert and experienced about his profession. He is very expert in getting milk from a buffalo; he gets it from all his buffaloes in no time. He has many buffaloes; this is the reason he has to work very hard to feed them. He has to spend a large part of his income on fodder; he appointed an assistant as well. Every day his assistant takes all the buffaloes to the pasture for grazing and gives them baths in the stream; he has to stay with his buffaloes the whole day due to fear of theft. 

M. Saeed is taking a loan to buy a cow to increase the herd and also use a portion for fodder. This way he can increase his monthly income and savings as well. Therefore, he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; so that he could buy a cow. M. Saeed gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a cow to get more milk.

loans.name: Mehran Naz

texts.en:
Mehran Naz is a 22-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a heart patient, and she always worries about his health. 

For seven years, her husband has run a welding shop, which is the only source of income for their family. All of her sons are very hardworking and help their father in his business a lot. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Brac Pakistan. Mehran Naz will use her portion to help her husband in purchasing welding material as needed for his shop. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business, and with the net profit, he will open a new shop for his son.

Mehran Naz dreams for her children's bright future and prays for her husband's good health. She wants to say that BRAC is working very well in the field of microfinance, and she is very thankful to BRAC and Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: to buy welding material for her husband's welding shop.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam is the 45-year-old married father of two children.

He has been working in the aluminum business since 1990. Issam is a hard worker who puts so much effort into supporting his family and providing them with the best education and living.

Issam is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner's Al Majmoua, to pay his children's school fees. His business is going on just fine, but he needs Al Majmoua's support to pay for the increasing school fees.

As for the future, Issam will invest an additional push to move forward, through a future-acquired loan from Al Majmoua.

This is his fourth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing paying-back history.

Issam is working hard to renew all of his machines and add new released ones to develop his business and expand it in a well managed way.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single man who has been working in selling accessories, stationery and silver since June 2012. 

This is his only source for living; that's why he works hard to develop his business in a well-managed way to attract more customers.

Ahmad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special silver designs and household appliances.

This is his first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower. He hopes that through a future relationship with Al Majmoua, he will work hard on expanding his working sector and diversify his products more to increase his income.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special silver designs and household appliances.

loans.name: Ayshah

texts.en:
Ayshah is 51 years old and a widow from a small area in Gaza city. She is the mother of three young sons. 

Ayshah works as an employee to afford the living expenses for her and her sons. She gets a low income, which is not enough to cover all the family needs. 

Ayshah has a problem in her leg joints, and she needs to take some medicine and do a surgery.

Ayshah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the costs of surgery for her legs. This will help her to go back to work and do all her daily activities.
 
Ayshah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of surgery for her leg joints

loans.name: Parveen Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 36-year-old hardworking and honest lady. She is a resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her husband, two sons and one daughter. Both sons are enrolled at a local school. 

Parveen's husband is a barber. His monthly income is insufficient. He works hard to meet the family's needs and expenses. To help her husband, Parveen wants to start sewing clothes at home. She has tailoring training already. 

Due to a lack of funds, Parveen, as a member of a two-person lending group, requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR from Kiva field partner, BRAC, for buying a sewing machine. She is hopeful that she can help her husband in this way. 

She wants her children to be well-educated citizens of Pakistan. Parveen is thankful to both Kiva and BRAC.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 43-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk for many years. She has one buffalo, and sells milk, along with the butter she makes from the milk, to many of her neighbors. 

Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has seven children; two daughters and five sons. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life and good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s her 4th year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business through it's support. Now she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves that she already has. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Faria

texts.en:
Faria, is a 68-year-old widow; she has six children, one of whom lives with her, and the others are married. 

She has an old sewing machine to work on, and feel so proud to be able to support her children without reaching out to others for help. She has gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to the quality of her work and affordable prices.

When she heard about Izdiharona's qard hassan product (without interest) for widow women, she took a loan to change her old sewing machine  and buy an iron and fabric to reduce her work hours and increase her profit.

She is aiming to provide the best life for her family. The story of Faria and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an iron, and fabric.

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Narin is a 27-year-old divorced mother of one child. When she got divorced, she had to find a place to rent and live in, and to pay for these expenses,  Narin bought a sewing machine and she gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to the quality of her work.

When she heard about Izdiharona's qard hassan product for divorced women (a without interest product), she took a loan to change her old sewing machine and buy an over machine to increase her profit.

She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits to provide a good life for her child.

The story of Narin and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an over machine.

loans.name: Ghamdan

texts.en:
Ghamdan is 28 years old, a single man who lives in Haja, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store that sells basic products. He started his business with  capital in order to open this grocery that would be able to support his young family. Because of his dedication to his work, he has been able to attract customers to his business. 

Ghamdan says he needs to fill his store with more food products in order to serve his customers. So he applied for a youth loan  from AMB to buy more merchandise for his business. In the future, He would like to expand his business to open a wholesale store instead of his grocery.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to use for his grocery store.

loans.name: Kajalrani

texts.en:
Kajalrani is a 56-year-old married lady and her husband, Sumanta, is 57 years old. They both belong to the small town of Mayanguri in Jalpaiguri. They have one child who is studying in class X (grade 10). Kajalrani is not educated, but can sign her name. Her husband has completed his education until X (grade 10). They both are running their poultry farm business but they are not earning so much profit from this business due to insufficient working capital. She needs a loan to buy more chicks, feed, medicine, etc. for her poultry farm to make her working capital strong so that she can earn more profit from her business. This business is profitable for them because the chicks grow very fast and once grown, they can sell their meat in the market and can earn easily from it.

They live in a pakka house (concrete house) but they do not having a personal sanitary toilet, so her dream is to make a personal sanitary toilet for them. They are experienced in the poultry field so they can understand the value of this business and can make profit easily. She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed, medicine, etc for her poultry farm business.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is age 24, and along with her husband, Shibeshwar, is raising her two children. Nilima and Sibeshwar both received education until class VII (grade 8). Both the children go to school and are in primary classes. They stay in a kaccha house (house made of mud, bamboo, straw, etc.).

Nilima wants to farm potatoes. With this loan, she will buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, with the profit she earns from her business, she wants to build a concrete house so that her children can have a better lifestyle. Nilima hopes that with the loan money, she can manage to expand their business without any problems. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BJS for the loan. She has proved that it is not that difficult to see the light by overcoming hurdles if financial assistance is received.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for farming potatoes.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma, 42, has an IV standard (Grade 4) education.  She is a housewife, married to Mohammad Ali, 55 years old, who is a farmer.  He has received only a primary education. They have three children.  One of them is in college; the second one is in X standard (Grade 10).  The third one is engaged in agriculture. Asma and her family live in the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. They own a kachha house (made of mud and straw).

To help her husband, Asma wants to take a loan to buy good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes. They hope they can sell more products in the market and can expand their business and make a profit from it to upgrade their poor financial condition.

They are hopeful to buy a Maruti car with the profit they will get from their business. They will rent this car as another means of income.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizers to grow poatoes

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 38-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, and is the mother of three children. Her husband, the only wage-earning person in the family, delivers luggage, grass, and water by using a donkey cart. He values the donkey cart more than any other possession, because it can make money for him to sustain their family life. 

He needs capital for the maintenance of the donkey cart. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult to pay for the maintenance.Therefore his wife Shaheen, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband. With the profits, they will be able to have some savings. Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: For the maintenance of the borrower's husband's donkey cart

loans.name: Azymkul

texts.ru: Азымкул 61 год, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает сына и внука, а также ведет свое хозяйство.  У Азымкул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Азымкул занимается животноводством, стартовав 11 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Азымкул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Азымкул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Азымкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение внука.
texts.en: Azymkul is 61 years old and a widow. After the death of her husband, she is taking care of her son and grandson on her own as well as running her farm. Azymkul has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Azymkul practices livestock breeding. She started this business 11 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Azymkul's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows on her farm. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Azymkul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Azymkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her grandson's future education.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Ioseb

texts.en: Ioseb is a 39-year-old married man. He lives in a small village of Lagodekhi district with his wife. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have cows and sheep. Ioseb's wife looks after them and produces cheese to sell. In addition, Ioseb owns a small agricultural land, where tomatoes, cucumbers and maize are grown. He is a very hardworking man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. As the income is only seasonal, he decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of $4,000 to purchase a minibus. After the minibus is purchased, he will start a trading business. He plans to purchase fruits and vegetables and then transport them to different villages to sell. This will increase the income of his family and with the increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus

loans.name: Ayan Yousuf

texts.en: Ayan Yusuf is 21 years old. She studies at Alpha University College, in the faculty of Information Technology. She needs a laptop to write her graduation thesis book, prepare assignments and read lessons when given in soft copy. She cannot pay the money all at one time. She approached Kaaba MFI and Kaaba will provide her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments. After university, Ayan hopes to work as an IT officer.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Bashir Masih

texts.en:
Bashir Masih is 46 years old and the married father of five children.

The income generated through his present herd is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so he decided to enhance his business of milk sales. He has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in his locality.

With the support of BRAC Pakistan, he has gradually improved his business. Currently he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase another buffalo.

This will help him to increase his sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for him. He is in his second loan cycle with a good repayment history.

Bashir Masih thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo to get more milk to sell.

loans.name: Eika Patricia

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar  Erika en su peluquería, quien con su credikiva hizo adecuaciones a su local y logró un cambio muy positivo, porque tiene más clientela satisfecha, mayores ingresos, y poco a poco está aumentando su calidad de vida. Ella dice a sus financiadores: “Gracias por el apoyo brindado” y nuevamente se postula a un credikiva, porque quiere continuar perfeccionado el servicio,  climatizando su espacio de atención al cliente, en esta tierra cálida y para ello comprará un aire acondicionado y una puerta corrediza, que dará mas seguridad y amplitud al local, y con ello logrará su objetivo de hacer sentir confortables,  a todos los que lleguen a su negocio, incrementando su clientela. Y Esto es lo que justamente  hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Erika in her beauty salon. With her Kiva loans she renovated her salon and achieved a positive change as her increased clientèle is happy, she has higher income and she is slowly improving her quality of life. She says to her lenders: "Thank you for the support you have given me". 

Once again she has come to Kiva because she would like to continue perfecting her service, and acclimatizing her workspace to improve customer service. Due to the heat where she lives she will buy an air conditioning unit and a sliding door which will increase security and space in her salon. With these changes she will help her clients feel comfortable and will increase her clientèle. This is exactly what will make her Kiva loan successful.

loans.use: to buy air conditioning and a sliding door.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabián tiene 43 años, está casado y vive en su casa propia hecha con bloques de adobe junto a sus dos hijos. Hace más de 17 años se dedica formalmente a la agricultura en sus terrenos de 2 hectáreas con el firme apoyo de su pareja y de los trabajadores que suele contratar para las diversas tareas. Es conocido en su zona por dedicarse integralmente a la producción de cacao orgánico y café porque considera que son los productos rentables a pesar de necesitar constantemente capital para realizar la compra de insumos como abonos orgánicos y herramientas para realizar sus tareas cotidianas con las facilidades del caso.
Sus terrenos se ubican a una hora de su localidad y eso implica incrementar el coste por el transporte que suele pagar para llevar sus granos secos desde sus terrenos hasta la ciudad donde se ubican los centros de acopio. Le agrada mucho su labor puesto que es una actividad que desempeñó desde muy niño junto a sus hermanos.
Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante,además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de maneta puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para adquirir abono orgánico y herramientas para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Fabian is 43 years old. He is married and lives in his own house made of mud blocks with his two children. For the past 17 years he has made a living farming his 2 hectare piece of land with the support of his partner and the workers he usually contracts to carry out different jobs. He is known in the area for working solely in the production of organic cocoa and coffee as he considers these products to be profitable despite constantly needing capital in order to buy supplies such as organic fertilizer and tools to carry out his everyday tasks easily.

His land is located an hour away from his area and this means he has to pay for transport to take the dried grain from his fields to the city where the collection centres are. He enjoys his job because he has done this since he was a boy together with his siblings.

This is his third loan cycle with Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial support he is receiving in order to continue getting ahead. Furthermore, he is committed to paying his monthly payments on time. On this occasion he hopes to receive 1,000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer and tools for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and farming tools.

loans.name: Erkebu

texts.ru: Эркебу 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Эркебу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Эркебу занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Эркебу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 3 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 2,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эркебу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эркебу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку холодильника.
texts.en: Erkebu is 56 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Erkebu has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Erkebu practices livestock breeding. She started this business 14 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Erkebu's hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows, 1 horse and 3 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 2,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Erkebu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Erkebu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Don Alfonso, tiene 60 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de La Lima, Cortes. Don Alfonso trabajo por muchos años con transporte de buses pero hace 3 años decidió con su esposa tener su propio negocio para cubrir los gastos del hogar y estableció una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica como ser carnes, refresco, churros, manteca, harina, productos de limpieza, huevos, pan, productos enlatados, lácteos, embutidos, plásticos, etc. El prestamo que solicito es por 15,000  Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas productos enlatados (salsinas, carnes, sardinas, vegetales mixtos, leches, etc.) y productos plásticos para la venta y asi poder tener variedad de productos para aumentar las ventas y sus ganancias. Su objetivo es  seguir creciendo con su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 60 years old. He is married, has two children and lives in the municipality of La Lima, Cortes. Alfonso has worked for many years as a bus driver but 3 years ago he decided to open his own business with his wife in order to cover the costs of maintaining his household. He set up a grocery store where he sells basic staple foods such as meats, drinks, chips, butter, flour, cleaning products, eggs, bread, tinned products, dairy products, cold meats, plastic items, etc. 

This loan is for 15,000 HNL which he will invest in buying more tinned products (sauces, meats, sardines, mixed vegetables, milk, etc.) and plastic items to sell and be able to offer a greater range of products in order to increase sales and earnings. His objective is to continue extending his business and get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy more tinned products (sauces, meats, sardines, mixed vegetables, milk, etc.) and plastic items to sell

loans.name: Pensamiento Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PENSAMIENTO” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Betty es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen:, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, venta de abarrotes, salón de belleza, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Betty es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, al necesitar una fuente de ingreso decide emplear la técnica de tejido como medio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el compartir con las integrantes de su grupo.
texts.en:
The “PENSAMIENTO” communal bank will be starting its tenth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes centre. It is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors of which Betty is the Treasurer. The businesses which the members of the communal association run are varied and among them are: selling food, selling cosmetics, selling groceries and a beauty salon.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen of which Betty is an example. She says she joined Pro Mujer six years ago after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she runs a business knitting jumpers. She says learnt this business several years ago, when she needed an income and decided to use knitting as a means of earning money.

The loan she is taking out is to increase capital to buy wool which she will buy from the wholesale markets in the city of El Alto and will use to make goods to sell. This kind of work allows her to generate income to maintain her family, since she is married and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes sharing with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, tiene la edad de 56 años, esta viudo y actualmente vive con su madre. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abonos para asistir su plantación de maíz. El cuenta con varios años ya de trabajar en esto tipo de siembras por lo cual necesita comprar estos productos y mejoras su plantación. El espera con esta mejora poder generar el máximo de producción y así aumentar las ganancias para su bienestar y el de su familia. El tienen pensado salir adelante con los pagos de su crédito también con lo generado con su cosecha de maíz y lo mas importante mejorar su economía. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Mario, 56, is a widower and lives with his mother.  He plans to use the loan to buy supplies, such as fertilizer, for his corn crop.  He has been working in agriculture for several years and needs to buy these products and make improvements on his cropland.  

Mario hopes to increase production to earn more profit for his family's well being.  He will pay back the loan with the income from his corn crop and, what is most important, his economy will improve.

This is his second loan through FUDECOSUR.  Mario has never received any state bank loans and FUDECOSUR is giving him better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To plant corn.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 28 años, está casada con Juan Carlos y posee una vivienda hecha a base de adobe donde vive junto a sus dos hijas. Desde muy niña creció en el ambiente agrícola donde aprendió gracias a sus padres el oficio de la agricultura con el deseo de usarlo en el futuro como su principal sustento económico. A trabajado desde sus inicios con el apoyo de su pareja y trabajadores que contrata para mantener en óptimas condiciones la parcela de 2 hectáreas y media que posee con las plantaciones de cacao, café, barbasco, achiote; entre otros. Una de las tareas que considera complicada es el retiro de maleza porque posee terrenos muy fértiles que promueven el rápido crecimiento de la mala hierba. Suele fertilizar el suelo de sus parcelas con abono orgánico porque según comenta espera algún día heredar sus terrenos a sus hijas y por ello evita el uso de fertilizantes artificiales que deterioran los suelos agrícolas a largo plazo. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con  1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Isabel is 28 years old, is married to Juan Carlos and lives in her adobe house with her two daughters. From being a very young girl she grew up in an agricultural setting where she learnt the skills of agriculture from her parents and hoped to use this in the future as her primary source of income. Right from the beginning she has had help from her partner and from labourers whom she hires to keep the land in top condition. She has two and a half hectares where she grows cocoa, coffee, barbasco, annatto and other crops. One of the jobs she finds difficult is clearing weeds because she has very fertile soil which promotes the rapid growth of weeds. She usually fertilises the soil with organic fertilizer because she says she wants to pass the land on to her daughters one day and this is why she avoids the use of synthetic fertilizers which damage the soil in the long term.

This is Isabel's second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is getting to make progress in life. She promises to pay her loan instalments punctually. On this occasion she wants to have 1,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.es: Ronaldo es originario de la ciudad de Estelí, de 50 años de edad. Es un señor casado y padre de dos hijos. Él es abogado, se dedica a la gestión de cobros, negocio que lo emplea desde hace varios años el cual le ha generado ingreso para su hogar. Su meta próxima es seguir dándole mantenimiento al sistema de drenaje sanitario. Solicita el crédito de saneamiento para mejorar las condiciones sanitarias de su vivienda, con el fin de garantizar un entorno familiar más agradable. Estima que el crédito le será de ayuda ya que lograra tener un mejor entorno en su domicilio, limpio y seguro. Su plan futuro es mejorar cada vez mejor las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ronaldo is from the city of Estelí. He is 50 years old, married and the father of two children. He is a lawyer and he makes a living working in debt collection. He has worked in this business for various years and it has provided income for his household.

His goal is to continue maintaining his drainage system. He is requesting a loan to improve the sanitary conditions of his house, with the hope of guaranteeing a more pleasant family environment. He hopes this loan with help him to obtain a better, cleaner and safer, living environment. His future plan is to continue improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to improve the sanitary conditions of his house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre agricultor de 35  años de edad, está casado y vive en Sololá.  El tiene cuatro hijos. Ellos estudian en una escuela de su comunidad y apoyan a su padre en el campo, en tiempos libres.
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla y cebollín en unos terrenos que renta en una finca, esta labor lo aprendió de su padre cuando era pequeño. Eligió esta actividad porque es rentable y  además tiene tiempo de realizar viajes en un carro que tiene. A través de la labor que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias  aceptables que le ayudan a contribuir con la economía de su familia.
El ahora cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en su propio cultivo, por lo que ha observado que en esta época del año existe una fuerte demanda en este tipo de actividad, de modo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de semillas de cebolla, abono químico y orgánico para luego cultivarlo y cosecharlo, con el propósito de mejorar  sus ingresos  y ganancias.
Su mayor sueño es seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y construir una vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a 35 year old farmer who is married and lives in Sololá. He has four children. They study at a local school and help their father in his fields in their free time.

He makes a living in farming by growing onions and chives in some fields that he rents from an estate. He learnt this labour from his father when he was young. He chose the activity because it is profitable and also because he has time to make journeys in his car. Through this work he obtains an acceptable income and earnings which help him to contribute to the family economy.

He now has 10 years experience with his own crops and he has noticed that at this time of year there is a greater demand in this type of activity. This is why he is requesting a loan for 6,000 GTQ to buy onion seeds, chemical and organic fertilizer to later grow and harvest, with the aim of improving his income and earnings.

His biggest dream is to continue supporting his children in their studies and to build a house in order to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds, chemical and organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Criselda Milagro

texts.es:
Criselda, es una joven soltera, vive con su madre y sus hermanos, ella hace un tiempo asistió a una capacitación donde aprendió a elaborar velas, tiene la característica de ser emprendedora y no ha dudado en poner en práctica lo aprendido, es así como ella genera ingresos por su cuenta pues tiene en su casa de habitación un pequeño negocio donde ofrece sus productos.
Con la inversión comprara espelma, mechas, colorantes y vasos para que su inventario este completo y poder trabajar sin inconvenientes, espera cancelar sus deudas, aumentar sus ganancias, y aportar más dinero para los gastos de su casa.
Desea tener una variedad de producto, para ofrecer a sus clientes, ampliar su negocio y mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Criselda is a single young woman who lives with her mother and siblings.  Some time ago she received training on how to make candles and, being very enterprising, there was no doubt in her mind that she should put what she learned into practice.  This is how she earns her own income and runs her small business from home where she offers her products.

She hopes that by investing in her business buying candle wax, wicks, colorings and glass jars her inventory will be complete so she can work without any inconveniences.  Her aim is to cancel her debts, increase her profits and contribute more money to the household economy.

Her desire is to have a wide variety of products to offer her customers in order to expand the business and improve her economy.

loans.use: To buy candle wax, wicks, coloring and glass jars.

loans.name: Jenny Griselda

texts.es: Jenny, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos  y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace 6 meses que decidió por generar sus propios ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos, elabora y vende tortillas de maíz, esta actividad la realiza en su casa y también sale a vender a otras colonias de la zona. El prestamo que solicita es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo  va invertir en la compra de una máquina para hacer tortillas y harina de maíz. Esta inversión le ayudara a tener mayor producción de tortillas. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio, ampliar el mercado y darle trabajo a mas personas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jenny, 31, is a single mother. She has three children and lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortés. Six month ago, she decided to generate her own income for the maintenance of her children. She is making and selling corn tortillas at home, although she also sells in the neighborhoods around the area.

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy a machine to make tortillas and corn flour. With this investment, she will be able to increase her tortillas production. Her plan is to expand her business, explore new markets and employ more people.

loans.use: to buy a machine to make tortillas and corn flour.

loans.name: Almakul

texts.ru: Алмакул 59 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 8 детей. У Алмакул - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Алмакул занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Алмакул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также имеет 4,9 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, фасоль, пшеницу и многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алмакул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алмакул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Almakul is 59 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising eight children. Almakul has a higher education. As the main source of income for her family, Almakul practices livestock breeding. She started this business 13 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Almakul's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows on her farm as well as a 4.9 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes, beans, wheat and perennial grasses annually. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Almakul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Almakul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene de 33 años, está casada con Víctor  tienen 04 hijos que viven en su casa hecha con bloques de adobe. Desde muy joven se inició en la agricultura con el apoyo de su esposo en un terreno de 2 hectáreas con el cultivo de cacao, café, barbasco y otros. Gracias a las ganancias que obtuvo con varios años de trabajo cumplió uno de sus principales objetivos que fue poner una tienda de bebidas esperando obtener ingresos adicionales. Lleva más de 8 años con su pequeño negocio y se dedica a ello principalmente en horas de la tarde y los fines de semana puesto que al residir en una zona tropical y calurosa el consumo de bebidas heladas es muy popular. Posee una gran variedad de bebidas heladas como gaseosas y refrescos preparados a base de cebada y maíz morada siendo este último el preferido de su clientela.
Le agrada mucho tener su negocio abastecido y es por ello que acude hace un tiempo a su entidad financiera para adquirir su mercadería al por mayor. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar bebidas gaseosas al por mayor, así como sacos de cebada fresca y maíz morado para la preparación de sus bebidas.
texts.en:
Gloria, 33, is married to Víctor, they have four children and live in an adobe brick house.  She has worked in agriculture since she was very young and, with the support of her husband, works on a two-acre patch of land where she grows cocoa, coffee, mullein and other crops.  Thanks to the profits she has earned over several years she was able to meet one of her main goals which was to open a soft drink store in an aim to earn more income.

she has been running this small business for eight years, working there mainly in the afternoons and on weekends, since she lives in a warm, tropical climate where ice cold beverages are in high demand.  She has a wide variety of drinks, including sodas and soft drinks made with barley and purple maize, the latter being the most popular.

She likes to have her business well stocked so she has been coming to financial institution for a loans to buy wholesale merchandise.  This is her third Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial support.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.

On this occasion she is requesting 1,000 PEN to buy wholesale sodas and sacks of fresh barley and purple maize to make her soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy wholesale soft drinks, fresh barley and purple maize.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Fredy con su actividad comercial, pues con su credikiva logró comprar, calzado, juguetería, artículos navideños, al por mayor y de contado, aumentando sus ventas, las utilidades del negocio y mejorando así sus ingresos. Él se siente ahora mas respaldado con Kiva y la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, tiene muchas mas esperanzas, para un mejor futuro de él y de su familia. Por eso dice a sus financiadores: “ Muchos agradecimientos, a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, espero seguir contando con este apoyo tan importante.“  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, mediante el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado, mercancía navideña, juguetería, ropa, calzado, aprovechando, que se acerca la temporada de fiestas, donde las familias (clientes)  gastan dinero en vestidos elegantes, calzado y con sus domicilios dotados de adornos ajustados a la época, para recibir alegres y bailando, las fiestas de fin de año y con cerrar el año en unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Fredy and his commercial activity; because with his CrediKiva loan he was able to buy Christmas items, shoes and toys wholesale and pay in cash.  This increased his sales and profits and improved his income.  With the support of Kiva and the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, he has higher hopes for a better future for his family and himself.  Therefore, he says to the lenders: "I am very grateful to Kiva and the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and hope to continue receiving this important support."

He is currently requesting a new loan to pay in cash and buy wholesale Christmas merchandise, toys, clothing and shoes.  He wants to take advantage of the holiday season when families (customers) spend money on elegant clothes and shoes, and adorn their homes for the season.
