They want to be happy and dance away the old year and celebrate the new year with family.

loans.use: To buy wholesale Christmas merchandise, toys, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es:
José, está casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo de un año, es un joven con ambiciones, sabe la responsabilidad que tiene con su familia, él es pilar principal de su hogar, debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su casa, inicio una venta de artículos de primera necesidad, poco a poco ha ido ampliando su negocio, necesita invertir en la compra de granos básicos, jabón, azúcar y otros. Para poner  a la disponibilidad de sus clientes productos que consumen con mucha frecuencia.
Espera mejorar sus ingresos, tener un negocio más rentable, cancelar sus deudas, tener sus clientes muy satisfechos y atraer a nuevos clientes.
Sueña con ver a su hijo convertido en un profesional, tener un negocio con más productos, tener una economía más sostenible.
texts.en:
José is married and lives with his wife and one-year-old son.  He is an ambitious young man and knows how responsible he must be for his family as head of household.  Since he must earn an income for household expenses he started selling essential food items and little by little the business has grown.

He needs to buy basic grains, soap, sugar and other items that are in high demand among his customers.  He hopes to improve his income, have a more profitable business, pay off debt, keep his customers satisfied and attract new customers.  He wants his son to have a professional career.  

José wants to sell more products and have a more sustainable economy.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, soap and sugar.

loans.name: Sayra Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Sayra tiene 40 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de dos hijos. Es una humilde señora de oficio comerciante, dedicada a la venta de productos variados (perfumes, cremas y cosméticos) además a la costura, negocios que le han generado ingresos para su familia. Ella con tanto esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos. Su meta próxima es culminar las mejoras de su vivienda. Solicita el crédito para mejorar las condiciones de saneamiento en su domicilio, con el fin de garantizar un hogar agradable y muy higiénico. Estima que con este crédito obtendrá  un cambio mejor en el ambiente de su vivienda, y mejores condiciones de vida para sus hijos. Su plan futuro es seguir manteniendo un mejor sistema de saneamiento seguro.
texts.en:
Sayra is 40 years old and comes from the city of Estelí. She is married with two children. She is a modest woman who works in retail, selling various products (perfumes, creams and cosmetics) as well as sewing. These businesses have provided her with an income for her family.

Sayra is asking for a loan to improve the sanitation facilities in her house, with the aim of making sure her home is pleasant and hygienic. She thinks that the loan will make a change for the better in her home environment and improve the living conditions for her children.

In the future she looks forward to having a safe and improved sanitation system.

loans.use: to improve the sanitation facilities in her home.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Para Carmen, mujer de 49 años de edad,  su vida transcurre en una máquina de coser desde hace 20 años, cuando su madre le enseñó el oficio de la costura y poco a poco ella, para sostenerse en el mercado y lograr una mejor calidad de las prendas de vestir, estudió técnicamente cada tarea de la confección y logró perfeccionar lo que su madre le había enseñado.
 Hoy diseña, corta, prepara, ensambla, termina prendas de vestir femeninas, masculinas e infantiles, con las que logra genera ingresos autónomos, vendiendo a crédito y de contado cada prenda de vestir, que usan las familias ubicadas alrededor de  su domicilio, donde habita y tiene su taller. Su meta es fortalecer cada vez mas su capital de trabajo y su planta física, pero su mayor desafió, es tener el dinero suficiente para lograrlo, lo cual la ha llevado a aplicar a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado, telas, hilos, botones, correderas y moldes, con ello logrará incrementar su producción en una de las temporadas comerciales de picos altos, para su negocio, como el fin del año y esto es lo que justamente hacen de su credikiva una buena inversión, con un potencial de éxito..
texts.en:
Carmen is 49 years old. Her life has taken place behind a sewing machine for the last 20 years, since her mother taught her the art of dressmaking. Little by little Carmen, to keep herself in the market and to achieve high quality pieces of clothing, has studied each part of dressmaking technically and has been able to perfect what her mother had taught her.

Nowadays she designs, prepares, assembles and finished men's, women's and children's clothing. With this she obtains her own income, selling on credit and making cash sales with each item of clothing which the families from her neighbourhood, where she lives and works, use. Her goal is to continually strengthen her work capital and physical workspace, but her biggest challenge is having enough money to do so. This has led her to request a Kiva loan. This is her first loan cycle with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy fabric, thread, zips and patterns, both wholesale and retail. With this she will be able to increase her production during one of the biggest selling periods of the year for her business, as is the end of the year. This is exactly what will make her Kiva loan a good investment, with potential success.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zips and patterns, both wholesale and retail.

loans.name: Sandra Cristina

texts.es:
La joven Sandra de 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos niñas, sus estudios los realizo hasta 9° grado, el motivo por el cual, no pudo seguir estudiando es por falta de recurso económico; desde entonces ella comenzó a trabajar en la venta de cosméticos, ropa y yuca con fresco junto a su madre, ella tiene cuatro hermanos uno de ellos ya falleció. Ella vive junto a su madre y sus otros hermanos.

La madre de ella se acompaño y hoy en día el señor esta enfermo y ella le ayuda a su madre económicamente para las medicinas. una de las hijas de Sandra, se graduara de kinder y la otra no esta estudiando; la pequeña párese de una enfermedad, que le produce un dolor muy fuerte en las articulaciones.

Sandra se dedica a la venta de ropa para hombre y mujer,  desde hace 4 años; esto lo aprendió por su madre. Ella decidió dedicarse a la venta, por que tiene que mantener a sus hijas, ya que el padre de ellas no le aporta mucho dinero y no posee otro tipo de actividad que pueda generar ingresos a la casa, el negocio de ella es ambulante no posee un puesto, ya que ella siente que vende mas vendiendo en casa por casa. Ella no tiene un horario de trabajo y no se involucra ninguna persona de su familia.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar pintura para la casa y alquilar unas mesas para la graduación de la hija, que celebrara en su casa y la otra parte lo invertirá en el negocio de ropa; ya que ella piensa comprar ropa de nuevos estilos para los clientes.  

La necesidad que sera satisfecha, es el poder celebrarle la graduación de kinder a su hija y poder comprar producto para la venta.   

El sueño que tiene ella, es lograr tener un lugar donde poder vivir tranquilamente, sin que nadie las moleste y que sus hijas puedan estudiar y llegar hacer unas profesionales, a demás que la chiquita se recupere de la enfermedad que tiene.
texts.en:
Young Sandra is 24 years old. She is a single mother of two girls. She studied up until 9th grade and then couldn't continue studying due to lack of economic resources. Since then she started working selling cosmetics, clothes and yuca with her mother, who has four children, one of which has passed away. She lives with her mother and other siblings.

Her mother found a partner who is now sick and she helps her mother financially so she can buy medicine. One of Sandra's children will graduate from kindergarten and the other one is not studying. The young girl suffers with a disease which causes her great pain in her joints.

Sandra has made a living for the past four years selling women's and men's clothing. She learnt this from her mother. She decided to make a living in this activity as she has to provide for her daughters, as their father does not contribute much money and she doesn't have any other type of business activity which can provide income to the household. Her business is itinerant. She doesn't have a stall as she feels she can sell more by going from house to house. She doesn't have a fixed timetable and no-one else in her family helps out.

The loan she is requesting is to buy paint for her house and rent some tables for her daughters graduation which they will celebrate in her house. The other part of the loan she will invest in her clothing business. She wants to buy new styles of clothing for her customers.
 
The need which will be covered is to celebrate her daughter's kindergarten graduation and to buy products to sell.

Her dream is to be able to have a quiet place to live where no-one will bother them and where her daughters can study and become professionals, as well as allowing the young girl to overcome her illness.

loans.use: to buy paint for her house and rent some tables for her daughters graduation which they will celebrate in her house. The other part of the loan she will invest in her clothing business.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья – предприниматель-сельскохозяйственник из Каменки. Она уже 5 лет занимается ведением тепличного хозяйства. Наталья выращивает овощи на участке родителей, а именно помидоры и огурцы. Ее семья молодая, сами зарабатывают, развиваются, воспитывают двоих детей. 
Наталье необходима сумма в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы установить отопление в новой дополнительной теплице. В этом году в Украине прогнозируется очень холодная зима. Наталья не хочет потерять ранние посевы и намерена утеплить свои теплицы. Она любит заниматься выращиванием овощей, планирует и дальше развивать бизнес, приобрести еще земельный участок и построить на нем новые теплицы.
texts.en:
Natalia is an entrepreneur-farmer from Kamenka. For five years already, she has run a greenhouse facility. Nataliya grows vegetables on her parent's plot of land, namely tomatoes and cucumbers. She has a young family. They earn their own money, improve their lives and raise two children. 

Natalia needs 10,000 hryvnia to put in a heating system in her new, additional greenhouse. This year they are predicting a very cold winter in Ukraine. Natalia does not want to lose her first sowing of seeds and is intent on winterizing her greenhouse. She loves her business of growing vegetables and plans to further develop her business, buy another plot of land and build a new greenhouse on it.

loans.use: to install a heating system in her new greenhouse.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анаре 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Анары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анара занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 лошадей, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку холодильника.
texts.en: Anara is 42 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Anara has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Anara practices livestock breeding. She started this business 20 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Anara's hard work, she currently has 8 horses and 10 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 3.000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Anara turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Anara plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

Благодаря упорному труду Элизатхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элизатхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 12,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Элизатхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку мебели.

Thanks to Elizatkhan's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow and 2 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 4,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Elizatkhan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Elizatkhan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy furniture.

loans.name: Mairamkan

У Майрамкан - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в университете, в качестве дополнительного дохода, Майрамкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Майрамкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майрамкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Майрамкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку зимней одежды для себя.
texts.en: Mairamkan is 36 years old and unmarried. Mairamkan has a higher education. She works as a teacher at a university. As a source of additional income, Mairamkan practices livestock breeding. She started this business 10 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Mairamkan's hard work, she currently has on 1 milk cow and 2 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 4,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Mairamkan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Mairamkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy winter clothing for herself.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Guluypa

Thanks to Guluypa's hard work, she currently has on 2 milk cows, 2 horses and 20 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 3,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Guluypa turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Guluypa plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy a refrigerator.

As the main source of income for her family, Aitbu practices livestock breeding. She started this business 14 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aitbu's hard work, she currently has on 2 milk cows, 1 horse and 10 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 3,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Aitbu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Aitbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Alymkan

texts.ru: Алымкан 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Алымкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Алымкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Алымкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 7 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). texts.en: Alymkan is 49 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Alymkan has a secondary education. Thanks to Alymkan's hard work, she currently has 5 milk cows and 7 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Alymkan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She also intends to save money to build a new house for her son.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Назиры - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Назира занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова,2 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Nazira is 41 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Nazira has a secondary specialized education. As the main source of income for her family, Nazira practices livestock breeding. She started this business 17 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nazira's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow and 2 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Nazira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 55,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Nazira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 47 years old and lives in the town of Masaka, which is in Uganda. She is married and has seven children of whom three are currently in school. For the past 17 years, Scovia has been working hard to manage her school, which provides teaching services. 

To help expand her school, Scovia has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand the school building, and it will help Scovia to generate greater profits and provide enough basic needs for her children. Scovia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her school business nationally. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Scovia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to expand the school building.

loans.name: Durdonokhon

texts.ru: Дурдонохон 19 лет, не замужем, проживает с родителями. У Дурдонохон - среднее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством, родители активно помогают в бизнесе. Очень трудолюбивая, ответственная и целеустремленная девушка. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Дурдонохон занимается животноводством, стартовав 1 год назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Дурдонохон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,32 ГА, на котором выращивает картофель, кукурузу, хлопок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дурдонохон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Дурдонохон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Durdonokhon is 19 years old, unmarried, and lives with her parents. Durdonokhon has a secondary education. She does farming and her parents actively help her in this business. She is a very hardworking, responsible, motivated young woman. As the main source of income for her family, Durdonokhon practices livestock breeding. She started this business one year ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Durdonokhon's hard work, she currently has 5 sheep on her farm as well as a 0.32 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes, corn and cotton. Her monthly income is 3,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Durdonokhon turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to fatten up and then resell at the market for a high price. Durdonokhon plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en:
Bukurie, who was photographed in front of her house, wants to buy a dairy cow. From the photo, you might guess that her living conditions are not that good. Livestock has been her activity for the past five years. 

Here is how Bukurie expressed herself during the interview:

“I have been able to make a little income from selling raw milk to the locals. When the milk production is a bit more, I make cheese and butter, and I sell them. In addition, I secure my family’s dairy needs almost all the time. Livestock is a good practice for us who live in the village, and the majority of us enjoy doing it, too.” 

Bukurie is a 41-year-old mother of three children who lives in the northern part of Albania.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edda

texts.en:
Edda is a married woman who rents a house that has no piped water but has electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
She has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gentlemen. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase cloth fabrics and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth fabrics and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María, tiene 50 años, vive con sus hijos, se ha visto en la necesidad de emprender su negocio, de antojitos en el cual ofrece  papas fritas, pasteles, yuca, etc. Para adquirir la materia prima necesaria está solicitando capital para comprar: maíz, frijol, yuca, papas, aderezos, aceite y queso.
Espera tener mejores ingresos, producir más variedad de antojitos, cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas, y atraer a más clientes.
Suela con tener un negocio más estable que le de las ganancias necesarias para seguir a poyando a sus hijos, darles mejor educación y salud de calidad.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and lives with her children. She saw the need to start her own business selling snacks such as potato chips, pies and cassava. She is requesting a loan to buy the ingredients she needs: corn, beans, cassava, potatoes, spices, oil and cheese.

With this investment, she hopes to increase her income, offer a wider variety of snacks, pay her installments on time and attract more customers.

She dreams of a more stable business with which she can earn enough to continue supporting her children, and give them a good education and a high-quality healthcare.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cassava, potatoes, spices, oil and cheese.

loans.name: Kairinisa

У Кайринисы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кайриниса занимается животноводством, стартовав 28 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кайринисы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 овца. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кайриниса обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Кайриниса планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.

As the main source of income for her family, Kairinisa practices livestock breeding. She started this business 28 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kairinisa's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows and 1 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Kairinisa turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy young bulls to fatten up and then resell at the market for a high price. Kairinisa plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Arzikan

texts.ru: Арзикан 53 года, разведена, одна воспитывает 6 детей. У Арзикан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Арзикан занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Арзикан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Арзикан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Арзикан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Arzikan is 53 years old, divorced, and is raising six children on her own. Arzikan has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Arzikan practices livestock breeding. She started this business 23 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Arzikan's hard work, she currently has 4 milk cows and 10 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Arzikan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy young bulls to fatten up and then resell at the market for a high price. Arzikan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es: Dulce es una señora de 45 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Rivas. Casada y madre de cinco hijos, los cuales dos aún están a su cargo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva. Inicio este negocio hace quince años incentivada por su hermana quien también vendía ropa, desde entonces decidió tener su negocio. Hoy en día cuenta con el negocio de venta de ropa, el cual le ha generado ingresos para su familia. Su meta próxima es realizar unas mejoras de infraestructura en su vivienda y seguir con el negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como: camisas, pantalones, artículos varios entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer una diversidad de productos a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a incrementar la mercadería en su negocio y obtener más ganancias. Su plan futuro es ahorrar para asegurar su futuro.
texts.en:
Dulce is 45 years old and married with five children, two of whom are still under her care. She is a native of the city of Rivas. Dulce is a businesswoman who sells new clothing. She started her business fifteen years ago, encouraged by her sister, who was also selling clothing at that time.  Today, Dulce’s business generates income for her family. She says that her next goal is to make some major improvements to her house and to continue with her business. 

Dulce is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as shirts, pants and other articles of clothing. She says that she wants to offer her customers a diverse selection of items, and she foresees that the loan will help her to improve her profit. Dulce says that her plan for the future is to save enough to be financially secure.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shirts, pants and other articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Muna Abdilahi

texts.en: Muna Abdilahi is 22 years old.  She studies at Alpha University College, faculty of Information Technology.  She needs a laptop to write her graduation thesis book, prepare assignments and read lessons when given in soft copy.  She cannot pay the money all at one time.  She approached Kaaba MFI and then Kaaba will provide her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments.  Muna hopes to improve her learning when she gets the laptop.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 38-year-old single man who has been working in selling books for the past nineteen years. He is the sole breadwinner for four members of his family and that's why he has to keep his business up to date and be ready to respond to any customers' needs.

Walid is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase his book inventory with newly released editions requested by his customers.  Walid is well known in his region with good quality products served and special prices.  Walid will keep on working hard to expand his business and open a larger bookstore and stationery department in a better region.

loans.use: To increase his book inventory with newly released editions requested by his customers

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
İlgar is 39 years old. He is an experienced builder, so he repairs home, paints walls, makes ceilings, and so on. He has been in this business for 9 years. 

He is a single man who lives with his mother. His mother is sick and she takes medication regularly. Ilgar’s family lives in Pirallahi village in Baki region.

He has applied for a loan in the amount of 1400 AZN to buy new materials (colors for walls, rollers for painting, plaster and other items) which are useful in his business.

He thankful to Komak and Kiva for their help. In the future, he wants to get married and have great family, and for his business he needs to hire an assistant.

loans.use: to buy new materials for his business.

loans.name: Topi Group

texts.en:
Tatu, who is in her early thirties, is single with two kids who are in school. Since 2008, she has been engaged in a genge (grocery store) business selling charcoal, fruits and vegetables. She is doing fine with her business and is able to make a fair monthly profit. Tatu normally works from 7 am to 9 pm every day. 

This will be her fifth loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania, and she will use it to restock more fruits and vegetables. With her previous loans, which ware all all paid back in full, Tatu purchased more business stock which made her genge attract more customers. She also purchased secondhand clothes, which she resells, and sacks of charcoal, which she divides up and sells in small packages. With her business profit, she covered home expenses, food expenses and school fees. Tatu dreams of buying a plot of land. 

She will share this loan with her loan group Topi, which consists of 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more fruits and vegetable for her business.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit lives and works at the Kapan city which is in the Syunik region.  He lives with his wife.  His two sons are married and they live with their families and his daughter lives and works in Yerevan city as an accountant.  Davit has been running his own business for twenty years; he has an auto repair shop.  He has a lot of customers who trust him very much, since he works properly and very conscientiously. 

Davit asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams in order to complete the repair of his space and to also buy the necessary tools.  This is Davit’s second loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to complete the repair of his space and to also buy the necessary tools

loans.name: 01.10.02 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh has a retail business selling clothes.  She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes and souvenirs to resell.

Minh is 55 years old and she is married with 2 children.  Minh is the group leader of the 01.10.02 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.  Minh supports no dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province since her children are grown up.

In 2012, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  Minh has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Minh has been involved in this business for 3 years.  The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Minh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and souvenirs to resell

loans.name: 02.01.15 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in her business for 3 years.She is requesting a loan to purchase chickens and pigs to raise and resell in the future.
She is 24 years old and she is married with 1 child.

Thúy is the group leader of the 02.01.05 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives with 1 dependent. in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thúy has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and pigs to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo has operated a food vending business, selling at the market to market dwellers and passersby.  She cites seasonality to be her major challenge.  She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans, and wheat flour for the business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support of a fast loan

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans, and wheat flour for the business.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es:
David, tiene 31 años, está acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de 18 años, se dedica a la acuicultura, aprendió el  oficio de su padre cuando era un pequeño, hace 10 años lo trabaja propio, de lunes a sábado en un horario de 6:00 a.m. a 12:00 p.m.
Necesita capital para comprar fertilizantes, plaguicidas, abono y semillas, para preparar la tierra y sembrar maíz y frijol. Con esto tendrá una cosecha muy abundante, mejores ingresos, y podrá cancelar las cuotas.
Sueña con tener un negocio muy rentable que le de los ingresos que necesitas para cubrir los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
David is 31 and lives with his partner and their 18-year-old daughter. He works in agriculture, which he learnt from his father as a young boy. He has been working in this business independently for 10 years, working from Monday to Saturday from 6am to 12pm. He needs capital to buy fertilizer, pesticide, manure and seeds, in order to prepare the land and sow maize and beans. With all this, he will have a good harvest and improve his income, and will be able to meet his repayments.
His dream is to have a profitable business that will afford him the income he needs to cover his household's costs.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, pesticide, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Nkanga Tukoregye3 Group

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old and a member of Nkanga Tukoregye3 Group. He is a father of four children and he takes care of all of them. He is described as a courageous person because he has always found a way to provide for his family, despite his busy schedule working as a pharmacist. He has so many people coming to his pharmacy.

Joseph will use this loan to buy supplies such as medicine and gloves, among other things, for the pharmacy. He says that his dream is to improve the living conditions of his family and to be able to pay for a private practice so that he can provide better health services for the people in his community. He is hard working and thanks Kiva lenders for being supportive of his group.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala lives in the village of Khabume. She is 56 years old, widowed and lives with her son, daughter-in-law, two grandchildren and retired mother. 

The source of income for the family is an agricultural business. They breed two milk cows, two calves and a pig. Besides, Makvala grows maize and sells the harvest at the local open market.
 
Makvala and her son, Badri, decided to start a new business as their existing income wasn't enough for the family. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

With the loan, Makvala will purchase a car and Badri will serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her son to use it as a taxi.

loans.name: 02.04.04 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Liên is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Liên is the group leader of the 02.04.04 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

Liên has a service shipping goods. Liên has been involved in this business for five years. In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to do a sand-shipping service.The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for a sand-shipping  service.

loans.name: E Jona

texts.en:
E Jona is a café social business start-up that aims to promote the social integration of Albanian youths with disabilities into the local community. E Jona, developed by Suela and her partners, won the Albanian Social Business Competition run by Yunus Social Business, against more than 50 other competitors. This loan will help Suela finance the start-up costs of the E Jona coffee shop and provide the business with working capital for its first four months of operation.

Around 137,000 people in Albania are affected by disability, which amounts to approximately 4.3% of the country’s population. One of the many struggles faced by young people with disabilities in Albania is the inability to lead a normal social life due to restricted access to social places that appropriately accommodate their needs. Public locations, such as cinemas, cafés, museums, restaurants and parks often have steps and other entry barriers in Albania. 

Suela wants to create a space where young people with disabilities can have opportunities to work, easily and comfortably socialize with friends and enjoy cultural activities. Furthermore, she wishes to foster the spirit of inclusion and to create an opportunity for non-disabled people to appreciate how joyful, inspiring and unique the life of a disabled person can be. Suela envisions that the space will become host to a unique atmosphere for exchanging skills and experiences between disabled and non-disabled visitors.

E Jona will be a café in Tirana, the capital city of Albania. The café will be easily accessible to its visitors, have a light and friendly atmosphere and host an exciting program of cultural and entertainment events. E Jona will target both disabled and non-disabled young people, offering a range of attractions such as the display of artwork and craftwork, musical performances, theatre evenings, jewelry making training, sign language and braille courses, etc. The café will serve cakes, cookies, sandwiches and other light snacks, as well as a range of barista coffees, teas and soft drinks. 

With a range of exciting events, competitive prices and quality food and drinks, E Jona hopes to rise above competing coffee shops in Tirana and prove that it is not just a café for disabled people, but an exciting venue that is open to all. 

Furthermore, the shop will employ six young people with disabilities to work as managers, bartenders, waiters and helpers. The profits earned by E Jona will be reinvested into improving the program of events at the café. 

As the first rent payment for the shop has already been paid, Suela is excited to open the doors to her café as soon as possible. Suela appreciates the time you took to read about E Jona. By lending to her business, you will help create an exciting place for Albanian youth, with or without disabilities, to work, interact and spend time together and make an impression on each other’s lives.

loans.use: to start up a café in Tirana catered to Albanian youth with disabilities, providing them with a friendly environment in which to work, socialize and showcase artistic and musical talents.

loans.name: Salah Ahmed

texts.en:
Salah Ahmed is 19 years old. He studies at Alpha University College, faculty of Business Administration. 

He needs a laptop to prepare assignments and read lessons when given in software copy. Lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students the software copy of the lessons. Getting the laptop will help him to improve his lesson preparation. 

He cannot pay the money all at one time. He approached Kaaba MFI. Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is from the Gori District. He is an internally displaced person and now lives in the refugee settlement of the village of Berbuki with his large family: his wife, two toddler children, parents, sister and two nieces. 

George runs a small-scale agricultural business and owns an apple garden. He sells his harvest seasonally. The only monthly income for the family is a small refugee assistance from the local government, which is hardly enough to cover feeding costs for the family of nine.

In order to generate income, George plans to start a trading business with fruits and vegetables. With the loan amount, he will purchase fresh products in bulk and sell them in his district with a price mark-up. George owns a mini-bus and will use it in making deliveries. George hopes his initiative will be lucrative and be able to increase family funds.

George and his family members are awaiting your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk for resale.

loans.name: 02.05.03 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Hào  is 23 years old and married with one child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.
 

Hào operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for two years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. 

Hào is the group leader of the 02.05.03 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members.  This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hào hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru:
59-летняя Мунавар занимается древним ремеслом - шитьем курпа и курпача. Это ватные стеганые одеяла, которые до сих пор являются главными бытовыми предметами в доме у таджиков. Курпача стелится на пол и используется вместо кресел, а курпа используется зимой в качестве одеяла во время сна. Мунавар занимается этим ремеслом в течение 5 лет. Ей в деятельности помогает единственная дочь. Мунавар замужем и имеет еще двоих сыновей. Она проживает со своей семьей районе Б.Гафуров города Худжанд. 
Услуга Мунавар всегда востребованная. Особенно когда люди устраивают свадьбу они в качестве приданого для будущей невесты или для своей дочери, выходящей замуж шьют на заказ курпа и курпача. Поэтому деятельность Мунавар день за днем расширяется и сейчас она нуждается в кредите. Мунавар собирается закупить хлопок и сшить большое количество ватных стеганых одеял.
texts.en:
Munavar is 59 years old and does an old craft, she sews quilts called kurpa and kurpacha. These are cotton quilts which are still the main household items in the homes of Tajiks. Kurpacha is put on the floor and is used instead of chairs, and kurpa is used in the winter as a quilt for sleeping. Munavar has been doing this for five years. Her only daughter helps her in the business. Munavar is married and also has two sons. She lives with her family in the region of Gafurov in the town of Khujand.

Munavar's service is always in demand. Especially when people hold wedding celebrations they make kurpa and kurpacha as a dowry for the future bride or their daughter who is getting married. This is why Munavar's business is growing day by day and now she needs a loan. Munavar wants to buy cotton to sew a large quantity of cotton quilts.

loans.use: to purchase cotton for sewing of cotton quilts.

loans.name: 02.04.05 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Thêu is 30 years old, married, and has two children. Thêu is the group leader of the 02.04.05 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

Thêu has a service business shipping goods. Thêu has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Thêu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2012, Thêu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thêu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to do a sand-shipping service. 

With her business profit, Thêu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for a sand-shipping service.

loans.name: 03.01.18 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Huệ is 25 years old and married with one child. She lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Huệ operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit.  Huệ has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

In 2012, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huệ is the group leader of the 03.01.18 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy. She also would like to remodel her house,

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: 03.02.03 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hòa is 37 years old and she is married with two children. She supports her two dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has a retail business selling various items. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase various items to resell.  In 2012, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 03.02.03 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of five members.

With her business profit, Hòa hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase various items to resell.

loans.name: Zulisma

texts.es: Zulisma de 57 años de edad habita muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde vende comidas rápidas, en un vehículo que ubica a un lado de su vivienda. Ella tiene tres años de experiencia y  con sus hijos, quien estudia técnica de cocina, se les ocurrió poner en práctica lo aprendido, teniendo en cuenta los productos que mas usualmente consumen en su población objeto. Así fue como a falta de un empleo decidieron que su hijo generaría sus propios ingresos familiares apoyándolo con el primer capital, con el cual les ha ido muy bien. Sus ventas las realizan de contado desde las 4 de la tarde a las 2 de la mañana de viernes a domingos y cuando es feriado.  Sus compras las hace a mayoristas y sus ventas las realiza directamente a sus vecinos del sector que son los clientes principales. Su meta más adelante es abrir un local, donde agregarle muchos mas productos que su hijo ha aprendido en  sus  estudios técnicos, para aumentar sus ingresos y poder apoyar a su familia, tanto como sea posible. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  4 juegos de mesas y sillas plásticas, e insumos de comidas rápida, como embutidos, salsas, grasas lácteos etc.  Con esta inversión logrará un mejor servicio a su clientela y dar respuesta a la enorme demanda que se avecina, en los meses de noviembre, Diciembre y Enero, épocas de fiestas, en la cual los estudiantes y muchos de los miembros de sus familias, se encuentran de vacaciones, y consumen mucho mas los deliciosos productos rápidos  que se preparan en el negocio de Zulisma. Lo cual hace que su credikiva, tenga mucho potencial de exitoso.
texts.en: Zulisma, 57, lives very close to the city of Barranquilla where she sells fast food from a vehicle that is located on one side of her house. She has three years experience and, with her children, who study culinary art, it has occurred to them to practice what they've learned taking into account the products most consumed by their target market. Due to a lack of employment, they decided that her son would generate his own family income supporting the business with the first capital with which they have done very well. Their sales are made in cash from 4 in the afternoon until 2 in the morning from Friday to Sunday and when it is a holiday. They make their purchases at wholesale and make sales directly to their neighbors in the area who are their main customers. Her future goal is to open a restaurant where she can add many more products that her son has learned in his studies in order to expand their income and be able to support her family as much as possible. Currently, she is applying for a loan, the first loan she's made with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy four sets of plastic tables and chairs and ingredients for fast food such as sausages, sauces, dairy fat,etc. With this investment, she will achieve better service for her customers and respond to the enormous demand that approaches in the months of November, December and January, the holiday season, when students and many members of their families are on vacation and consume a lot more of the delicious fast products that are prepared in Zulisma's business, which means her loan has potential for success.

loans.use: to buy four sets of plastic tables and chairs, ingredients for fast food like sausages, sauces, dairy fat etc.

loans.name: Elizah

texts.en:
Elizah operates a food vending business, selling at the market to market dwellers and passersby. In addition, she has a retail shop business. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future and she appreciates the previous loan, which helped her to repair her retail premises.

With the KES 60,000 she wants to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans, and wheat flour for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans, and wheat flour for the business.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: 63-year-old Aurelia is a married woman from Loboc, Bohol. She has two grown children and relies on hog raising for an income. For three years now, this is her livelihood. Aurelia is requesting a loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos to buy piglets to be added to her piggery. With the availability of additional capital, Aurelia will have the chance to expand her business and make the most out of her investment. Her income will provide savings and healthy food for herself and her husband. Aurelia dreams of making her business bigger to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Rafiq Masih

texts.en:
Rafiq Masih is 48 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a general store for many years near his house and the business is operating very well. 

Earlier, he was selling bakery items in large quantity, but according to the customers' demand, he wants to offer rice, sugar, flour, etc. also. He does not want to refuse any product and disappoint any of his respected customers. He wants to offer all those products that are necessary and consumable in daily routine. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well.
 
Therefore, Rafiq Masih requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he could buy the sacks of rice, sugar and flour. He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.
 
Rafiq Masih is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and he assures that he will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, sugar and flour for the general store.

loans.name: Ayan Ahmed

texts.en:
Ayaan Ahmed is 20. She studies information technology at Alpha University College, and she is a senior student.

Her problem is that she has no laptop, and it’s difficult for her to practice. She has informed Kaaba-Kiva laptop loans and she would like to have a laptop as a loan. She approached Kaaba MFI and Kaaba will provide her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Hodo Aden

texts.en:
Hodo Aden is 26. She studies information technology at Alpha University College and she is a senior student. 

Her problem is that she has no laptop, and it’s difficult for her to practice and also to prepare the research paper of her graduation. She has informed Kaaba-Kiva laptop loans, and she would like to have a laptop as a loan. She approached Kaaba MFI, and Kaaba will provide her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is single and has two school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

For the past four years, Emily has operated a food vending business selling fried potatoes at the market to market dwellers and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase cooking fat and wheat flour for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Tièssiri  est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koko de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les médicaments, les condiments les chaussures, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
 Kadia  est un membre du groupe Tièssiri accroupie au bout à gauche, elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chaussures en gros. Elle se procure de ces marchandises au grand marché de Koutiala. Elle vend en détail et en gros,  au comptant et à crédit à la maison  et au marché à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 62 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Kadia compte réaliser  63 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Tiessiri is a collective of women from the Koko district of the city of Koutiala. These women live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. On average, they are 28 years old, married and have at least four children. This group of women trades in various items, such as medication, condiments, shoes etc. In order to increase the size of their business, the members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit initiative. This is their first group loan. 

Kadia, a member of the Tiessiri Group, is the woman squatting down in the bottom-left of the photo. She intends to use this loan to buy shoes in bulk. She procures this merchandise from the Koutiala main market. She sells in both retail and wholesale, accepting cash and credit, working from home and at market, to a diverse and varied client base. Whereas the other group members intend to each earn an average profit of 62,000 CFA during the loan period, Kadia intends to earn 63,000 CFA. On top of paying back the loan, they will use part of the revenue to pay for personal expenses and to grow their business.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Ahmadah

texts.en:
Ahmadah is 42 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the  region of Masaka in Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past eight years, Ahmadah has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells home products. 

To help expand his business, Ahmadah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of sugar, rice, maize flour and groundnuts for the shop, and it will help Ahmadah to generate greater profits and to buy home necessities. Ahmadah hopes that in the future, he will be able to open up another retail shop in Masaka town. 

Ahmadah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ahmadah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of sugar, rice, maize flour and groundnuts for the shop.

loans.name: Dolores Elizabet

texts.es:
Dolores, es una persona que vive junto a su padre y sus hermanos en una casa familiar que pertenece a su papá, en su afán por ayudar en los gastos de su hogar emprendió un proyecto en el que instalo un pupuseria, venta de panes y tortillas, atiende el negocio sola, en ocasiones le ayudan sus cuñadas, el negocio está ubicado en su residencia.
Comprará maíz, frijoles, quesillo, pollo, tomates, cebolla, repollo, etc. Son su materia prima para que el negocio funcione y siga dándole ganancias que utilizara para ir cancelando sus cuotas y aportar más en los gastos de su casa.
Sueña con tener un negocio más amplio, clientes satisfechos y cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Dolores is a person who lives with her father and brothers in a family home that belongs to her father. In her eagerness to help with the expenses of the home, she launched a project in which she opened a pupusa store selling breads and tortillas. She tends the shop alone, though on occasion her sisters-in-law help her. The business is located in her home.

She will purchase corn, beans, quesillo (a soft Salvadorian cheese), chicken, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, etc. This is her raw material because of which the business functions and continues to give her profits that she will use to make her payments and contribute more to pay the home expenses.

She dreams of having a larger business, satisfied customers, and to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, quesillos, chicken, tomatoes, onions, and cabbage.

loans.name: Belizario

texts.es:
Belezario tiene 60 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, ubicado a 20 minutos de Pucará, su población sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, perteneciendo a Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

El es conocido por la labor que realiza, tiene un taller ubicado en su domicilio de carpintería metálica, elabora diferentes productos de metales como puertas, ventanas, escaleras, tiene una familia unida, su hijo mayor brinda el servicio de transporte en la mototaxi de la familia.

Nos explica que está solicitando un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para compra de materiales y herramientas para carpintería y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Belezario is 60 years old and lives together with his wife and children in the district of Pomahuaca, located 20 minutes from Pucará, Perú.  The main activities in the area involve agriculture, commerce, and raising livestock.  He is situated in Jaén, in the mountains to the north of Perú.

He is known for his work and his metallic carpenter's shop, located in his home.  He makes different metal products like doors, windows, and stairs.  He has a very close family, and his oldest son offers transportation services via the family's motorcycle taxi.

He explains that he is asking for a loan of 3500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to purchase materials and tools for carpentry and in this way he will be able to improve his family income.

loans.use: To purchase metal materials and tools for carpentry.

loans.name: Maria Yudith

texts.es:
María, vive junto a su mamá y su hermana, se dedica a vender zapatos y sandalias para ambos sexos en variedad de estilos, colores y tallas, desde hace mucho está ejerciendo está actividad económica, por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema para realizarla.
Comprará zapatos tenis, sandalias, zapatos para niños y así tendrá un inventario muy surtido para que sus clientes puedan quedar satisfechos con sus productos, generara mayores ventas y mejores ingresos.
Anhela tener ingresos que le permitan cancelar la deuda y comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
María lives with her mother and her sister. She makes a living selling shoes and sandals for both sexes in a variety of styles, colors, and sizes. For a long time she has been practicing this economic activity. For the moment she has not had any problems carrying it out.

She will purchase sneakers, sandals, children’s shoes, and so will have a well-supplied inventory. Her customers can then be satisfied with her products, which will generate higher sales and a better income.

She aspires to have a higher income that will allow her to pay off her loan and to purchase her own home.

loans.use: to purchase sneakers, sandals, and shoes for children.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en: Anastase is a father of two children. He sells various items in his boutique. With this loan, he is planning to buy more cooking oil and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Ana Rosario

texts.es:
Ana de 35 años de edad, esta acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la albañilería, al mismo tiempo trabaja en las actividades agrícolas. Ana estudio hasta noveno grado de educación, con esta preparación se defiende  en sus labores diarias. Dejo los estudios para ayudarle a sus padres, en las actividades agrícolas y mas tarde se acompaño con su actual pareja.  Con ella viven sus dos hijos, el mayor esta estudiando cuarto grado.
Ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la escuela del cantón. Vende panes con pollo, golosinas, jugos naturales entre otros productos. Anteriormente, le habían dado trabajo como vendedora en una pequeña tienda; pero prefirió tener su propio negocio, desde hace 10 años tiene ese negocio en esa escuela. El negocio se encuentra a cuadra y media de su casa y trabaja ahí de lunes a viernes.
Ana necesita el crédito para invertir, en la compra de mas insumos, para surtir su negocio, para vender en su casa, ya que se ha terminado la temporada escolar y ya no vende en la escuela. Por tal razón, quiere invertir en este negocio aprovechando así la época navideña. De esta manera, ella podrá seguir trabajando  y recibiendo ingresos para su familia.
Ella desea que su negocio se amplíe y que esto le pueda generar ingresos suficientes, para cubrir con las necesidades básicas de su familia. Que sus hijos puedan lograr estudiar y sacar estudios universitarios que les permita tener mas oportunidades de empleo  o de comenzar un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Ana, 35, is in a relationship and her partner is dedicated to masonry. At the same time he performs agricultural work. Ana stayed in school up to the ninth grade. With this preparation she fends for herself in her daily work. She left school to help her parents with farm work and, later, accompanied her current partner. Her two children live with her. The eldest is in the fourth grade. She has a small store in the area's school. She sells breads with chicken, candies, natural juices, among other products. Previously, they had given her work as a seller in a small shop but she preferred to have her own business. For ten years, she has had this business in the school. The business is located a block and a half from her house and she works there from Monday to Friday. 

Ana needs the loan to invest in the purchase of more items to stock her business to sell from her house since the school year has ended and she doesn't sell in the school anymore. For that reason, she wants to invest in this business taking advantage of the holiday season. In this way, she will be able to keep working and receiving income for her family.

She wishes that her business expands and that this can generate sufficient income to cover the basic necessities of her family, that her children can continue their education and go to university which will allow them to have more job opportunities or start their own business.

loans.use: to buy items needed to install a shop in her house.

loans.name: Servelio

texts.es: Servelio, tiene  43 años de edad, esta casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar con volquetas en acarreo de materiales de construcción como tierra, arena, piedra, grava y otros. Hace 8 años que tiene su propio vehículo para prestar el servicio de acarreo de materiales. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar llantas para la volqueta y poder prestar un mejor servicio y mejorar los ingresos. Su sueño es comprar una volqueta mas para trabajar.
texts.en: Servelio is 43 years old and is married.  He has three children and lives in the city of Choloma, Cortes.  He has always worked with dump trucks carrying construction materials such as dirt, sand, rock, gravel and other items.  For the past eight years he has had his own vehicle for offering transport and construction material services.  The loan that he is requesting is for 15,000 Lempiras (Honduran currency), which will be used to buy tires for the dump truck and to be able to offer better service and thus receive better income.  His dream is to buy another dump truck in order to take on more work.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his dump truck used for transporting construction materials.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 28 años, está casada con Virgilio de 30 años junto a sus dos pequeños en su casa propia hecha a base de madera.Es una mujer dedicada íntegramente a las actividades agrícolas concernientes a la producción de cacao y café orgánico en su localidad. Desempeña esta labor desde muy niña y desde hace dos años cuenta con un terreno propio y se encuentra próxima a proceder con la cosecha de algunos productos. Sus tareas agrícolas las desempeña principalmente con el apoyo de su esposo y trabajadores quienes apoyan también en tareas de deshierbo y  traslado de las cosechas puestos en sacos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 28 years old and is married to Virgilio, 30 years old. They live together with their two small children in a house made of wood, which they own. She makes her living entirely through agricultural activities, producing organic cacao and coffee in her area. She has been doing this type of work since she was a girl; she has had her own plot for two years, and she is about to start harvesting some crops. She handles her agricultural tasks mainly with the help of her husband and workers, who also help with weeding and transporting the crops, which have been put into sacks. 

This is her fourth loan with Kiva; she is thankful for the financial help that she receives to keep moving ahead, and she is committed to making her payments on time. For this loan, she is requesting 1,000 nuevos soles to by organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Essivi

texts.fr: Madame Essivi âgée de 36ans est mariée à un chauffeur et père de 03 enfants tous scolarisés. Pour contribuer aux besoins du ménage, elle revend des produits alimentaires, des couches pour bébé et autres produits au marché. N'arrivant plus à bien répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle espère à l'avenir, avoir un grand étalage et bien s'occuper de la famille.
texts.en: Essivi, who is 36 years old, is married to a driver and mother to three children who are all at school. In order to be able to contribute to the household expenses, she sells food products, babies' diapers and other products at the market. Since she is no longer able to meet customer demand, she is requesting a first loan to buy more stock. She hopes in the future to have a large stall and also to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy food products, babies' diapers and shoes.

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es:
Bartola tiene 53 años de edad, vive en Santa Julia una zona rural de Morropon, los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado, comercio y ventas de todo tipo, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un bodeguita en su domicilio donde ofrece abarrotes y venta de pollo pelado y carne de res, nos explica que se dedica a esta actividad hace 10 años.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para abastecer su bodega con la compra de frutas y verduras y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bartola is 53 years old and lives in Santa Julia, a rural zone of Morropon.  Residents in the area work raising cattle and in commerce and sales of all kinds.  They are located two hours from the city of Piura, along the northern coast of Perú. 

Bartola has a small store in her home where she offers groceries and sells chicken and beef.  She explains that she has been working in this field for ten years.  

She is asking for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to supply her store with fruits and vegetables and in this way have a better income in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, including fruits and vegetables, in order to supply her store.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Netor tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en Macuaco una zona rural del distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y agricultura, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

En su domicilio tiene una bodega donde ofrece venta de abarrotes, con la ayudad e su hija mayor elaboran helados con frutas de la zona.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar una vitrina congeladora para exhibir los helados y postres que piensan elaborar y de esta manera captar más clientes , generando ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Netor is 46 years old and lives with his two children in Macuaco, a rural zone in the district of Oyotun.  The population there works raising small livestock and in agriculture.  The town is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Perú.

In his home Netor has a store where he sells groceries, and with the help of his oldest daughter they make ice cream with fruit from the area.  

He is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to purchase a display case freezer in order to exhibit their ice creams and the desserts that they are planning to make. In this way he will attract more customers, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer display case.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 28 years old. He is unmarried and he lives alone.  Armen has graduated from Yerevan State University .  Following several years of hard and devoted work,  he now is working in a hydro-electrical station. Simultaneously, he is engaged in farming. On his farm he has cows, piglets, and chickens, and he takes care of them perfectly. 

Armen has decided to get a decent income with the coming of the New Year. This is the reason for requesting a second loan with Kiva. He asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a quantity of animal fodder for his piglets. He plans to feed them for half a month and then sell them.  Armenian people make their  main New Year’s dish from pork, so  that is why the demand for pork is so great during that period.

loans.use: to buy a quantity of animal fodder for his piglets

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene  25 años de edad,  vive en unión de hecho con su pareja y  tienen  dos hijos de tres  y seis años de edad, el mayor  se encuentra estudiando y viven en Sololá.
Ella se dedica al cultivo de  verduras como zanahoria, papa y maíz, para después  cosecharlos y comercializarlos en el lugar de su residencia, lo realiza  desde hace 6 años ya que estas verduras mantienen mejores precios en el mercado, quiere seguir cultivando estas verduras en mas lugares para obtener mejores ganancias, por lo que ahora está solicita un crédito de Q 3,000.00 quetzales,  para la compra de una cuerda de zanahoria para luego comercializarlo y así poder mejorar sus ganancias.
Sueña con tener una vivienda mejorada  y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que en un futuro se puedan desarrollar en un trabajo.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 25 years old and lives with her life partner.  They have two children ages three and six, and the oldest is in school.  They live in Sololá.  She works growing vegetables like carrots, potatoes and corn.  She harvests and sells them in her place of residence.  She has been doing this work since she was six years old.  Since the vegetables maintain better prices at market, she wants to continue cultivating vegetables in more places in order to obtain better income. That is why she is asking for a loan of 3000 quetzales  (Guatemalan currency).  The money will be used to purchase a cord of carrots in order to sell them and thus improve her income. 

She dreams of having a better home and helping her children in their studies so that in the future they can develop in their work.

loans.use: To purchase a cord of carrots in order to sell them.

loans.name: Charly

texts.fr: Charly est un homme de 33 ans marié, père de deux enfants de 2 et 4 ans. Après sa formation, il a ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'il gère depuis 8 ans déjà. il a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques,tondeuses et petit matériel dans son institut parce qu'il achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. il sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en: Charly is a 33-year-old married man and father of two children aged two and four. After finishing his training, he opened a hairdressers, which he has been running for eight years. He often has problems within his business due to a lack of cosmetic products, hair clippers and everyday items because he buys his products in small amounts. His goal is to satisfy his clientele and to make a large profit. He has requested a loan in order to be able to buy his equipment in large quantities, which will allow him to reach his targets. The profits made from this loan will help him to satisfy both his and his family's needs, as well as leaving him with some savings to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and everyday items in order to fix up his hairdressing business

loans.name: Leocadie

texts.fr: Leocadie est une femme de 49 ans veuve et  mère de 5 enfants. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( maniocs, bananes et plantains) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital.
